intro: Spergula pentandra subsp. vernalis, commonly known as spring betony, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers in whorled clusters, which bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate, and have a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks.
